oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd Archive
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |han=kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: What Bushmen do when an eclipse of the sun takes place. By /han=kasso (L VIII.-28. 8438-8441). They strike sticks together, as well as shoes, to make the sun come out. 1) p.8438opp: |han=kass'o observed these practices himself; how people describe the eclipse, 2) This story is found in Book VIII-28.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: What is done by the Bushmen (men and women) in an eclipse of the sun
